alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 6:21PM CDT until August 29 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: .The storm complex is moving south and should move out of the advisory area before 7pm. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, in northwest Texas, Floyd and Motley. In the Panhandle of Texas, Briscoe and Hall. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 621 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Lockney, Quitaque, South Plains, Flomot, Valley Schools and Aiken. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
